posts.post_content:
Definitely insane for duel, but not so good in multiplayer.  
  
@Mistdancer : No. According to the comprehensive rule 603.6e, True-Name Nemesis' ability is a static ability, so it doesn't use the stack. Because of this, you can't answer it with Abrupt Decay or Swords to Plowshares.
posts.html:
Definitely insane for duel, but not so good in multiplayer.

posts.post_content:
Yes this card is very good, but:  
  
In commander this card is not overkill, its good vs 1 player, but someone throws a WoG or another kind of WoG effect during each of 4 cycles of players, or earlier, to blow up the field. (happens all the time).   
  
For legacy this is a new threat that surely will see play. But its not as overated as the previous messages imply.  
Remember: Choosing a player with the abilty comes on the stack!  
This means that when the nemisses enters play (and isnt counterd), it can still be: abrupt decayed, lighting bolted, stifle-ed, plowed, sliped, pyroblasted or any other instant removal can be used you can think of, before the "player proof" abilty gets active.   
Even then prevention shields can be made to prevent dammage dealth to you by the nemesis (legency decks dont use prevention, but in commander this is a valid point)  
  
In legacy this is a card to get rid of through countering or intant removal, but when put into play only (currently used) cards as p.deed and term... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:

For legacy this is a new threat that surely will see play. But its not as overated as the previous messages imply.
Remember: Choosing a player with the abilty comes on the stack!
This means that when the nemisses enters play (and isnt counterd), it can still be: abrupt decayed, lighting bolted, stifle-ed, plowed, sliped, pyroblasted or any other instant removal can be used you can think of, before the "player proof" abilty gets active.
Even then prevention shields can be made to prevent dammage dealth to you by the nemesis (legency decks dont use prevention, but in commander this is a valid point)

Posted By: Mistdancer (11/1/2013 3:25:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Discard Spells, Counter Spells, and [Toxic Deluge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Toxic Deluge) all get it.   
  
[Nevinyrral's Disk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nevinyrral's Disk) isn't allowed in Legacy. I admit I'm scratching my head to think of \*many\* answers, but I'm sure Toxic Deluge is at least \*one\* answer that's gotta be Legacy Playable. [Infest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Infest)? does that break in to Legacy?  
  
Red and Green have terrible matchups in general against this card- I can't think of a spell answer in either of them, besides "be the combo deck that wins the game first". Having extremely good odds to beat 2/5 of the Color Wheel, on a 3-cost 3-power Blue Creature, is obviously really good. Plenty of Black or Blue cards out there that I think this card isn't going to be the same kind of game-closer that [Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Progenitus) has been, and Progenitus isn't as good as [Emrakul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul) or [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand).   
  
Legacy PLAYABLE undoubtedly, Legacy UNBEATABLE? hardly. [Scavenging Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scavenging Ooze) was so ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: feedbacker (11/13/2013 8:13:50 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Okay... what irks me about this guy is a bit more than the protection... it's how the protection is triggered  
  
"as it comes into play choose a player"   
  
It's not a regular etb effect, it's akin to [clone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=clone)... it enters with the player chosen, so you can't respond to the opponent choosing you as the opponent. It makes me love and hate it all the more for it's depravity. It doesn't even use the "when this creature enters..." clause so i don't think you can stifle it either...  
  
On another note, i think i need to stock up on [phantasmal image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=phantasmal image)s if i REALLY wanted to abuse this card...  
  
How i feel about the card is confusing... i now understand how Myron Reducto must feel about Inch High
posts.html:

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (11/12/2013 2:11:02 PM)

posts.post_content:
This is the first non-white card granting either variable or absolute protection (outside of [Greater Morphling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Greater Morphling)).  
  
For one more U, we've upgraded [Invisible Stalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Invisible Stalker) by tripling its power, immunizing it to all creatures an opponent controls, and stapling one of the most popular creature types onto it.  
  
Despite the power I rate this card average because of the flavor paradigm shift, abuse of the protection mechanic (Progenitus-like), and shameless pandering to Legacy.
posts.html:
This is the first non-white card granting either variable or absolute protection (outside of Greater Morphling).

For one more U, we've upgraded Invisible Stalker by tripling its power, immunizing it to all creatures an opponent controls, and stapling one of the most popular creature types onto it.

Despite the power I rate this card average because of the flavor paradigm shift, abuse of the protection mechanic (Progenitus-like), and shameless pandering to Legacy.
